data.title: Terry L. Deitz
data.meta_description: A memorial visitation will be held from 5:00-7:00 p.m., Wednesday, July 3, 2024, at the Estes-Leadley Holt/Delhi Chapel. Memorial donations may be made to an animal rescue of the donor's choice.
data.text:
Age 63, passed away, June 30, 2024. He was born February 22, 1961 in Lansing to Gordon and Lois (Mears) Deitz.

Terry worked for many years at Inco Graphics as a graphics film stripper, but loved his time as a retired person. He also loved camping, bonfires, Nascar, working on his car, but most importantly he loved getting together with his children, grandchildren, and his large family. Terry was a generous person who would help anyone at any time.

The family would like to extend a special thank you to Julia DeRosa and Ann Stephens for their hospitality to Terry.

Terry is survived by: his daughters, Rachelle (Joseph) Rodriguez, and Kristina ( J.R. Meddaugh) Deitz; grandchildren: Tristian (Brittany) Howard, Ethan Deitz, Rozlynn Howard, Dominick Davis, Drew Hubble, Daniel Hubble, Alexandria Patton, James Deitz, and Jonathon Deitz; great granddaughter Mylah Howard; siblings: Gordon (Peggy) Deitz, Nancy (Brenda Stoneburner) Deitz, and Diana (Bruce) Rochowiak; brother-in-law Dan Allen; as well as numerous nieces, nephews, cousins, and other extended family members.

He was preceded in death by his parents, a daughter Mariah Bogard, a son William Deitz, and a sister Suzette Allen.

There will be a memorial visitation held 5:00-7:00 p.m., Wednesday, July 3, 2024, at the Estes-Leadley Holt/Delhi Chapel, 2121 Cedar St., Holt, Michigan 48842. Memorial donations may be made to the animal shelter of the donor’s choice.
